title: MAG 175 - Epoch Transcript-converted
text:
. 
MARTIN 
(Sigh) Yeah, alright. I get it. But what about the, real world, were they right? 
ARCHIVIST 
I-I'm not sure I follow. 
MARTIN 
I mean— Right, if none, if none of this had happened, if the world had just… 
carried on? What would have happened? Was, was all that fear justified? 
ARCHIVIST 
I can't know the future, Martin, not even a hypothetical one. 
MARTIN 
But, you know what was going on, what was happening. O-out of everyone, 
you're the best placed, you, you've got the info to make a pretty damn 
educated guess! 
ARCHIVIST 
I, I don't know what you want me to say, Martin. Yes, i-it was bad, worse than 
most people thought and, things were only going to deteriorate. Was the end 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 175 – Epoch 
13 
of humanity actually imminent? I- probably not? But we were well on the way, 
and, it would have been the end of an awful lot of things. 
MARTIN 
So you don't think it would have been the end of the world? 
(A small laugh from the Archivist) 
ARCHIVIST 
The end of the world. Now there's a concept. Everything ends, I suppose. Even 
this place… can't last forever. Eventually, it will die as well. 
MARTIN 
You're starting to sound like Simon. 
ARCHIVIST 
No. He was always looking towards the infinite, but I'm not sure there is such a 
thing. If I try, I can— 
[Hissing static starts] 
ARCHIVIST (CONT’D) 
—see the edges of reality, but, I can't hold its full scope in my mind. 
[Hissing static ends] 
MARTIN 
And beyond it? 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 175 – Epoch 
14 
ARCHIVIST 
Beyond what? Reality? 
MARTIN 
Yeah. 
[Hissing static starts] 
ARCHIVIST 
(Exhale) I don't know. Maybe nothing. 
(Beat) 
[Hissing static ends] 
[Damp couch creak as Martin shifts] 
MARTIN 
(Thoughtful) John. 
ARCHIVIST 
What? 
MARTIN 
D'you know if, like, gods, religion, the afterlife, all that stuff. Do you know if 
any of that was real? 
ARCHIVIST 
(Gently amused) Really rolling out the big questions today. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 175 – Epoch 
15 
MARTIN 
(Chuckling) Sorry, it's just, this place just brings it out in me, I guess. 
[Hissing static starts] 
ARCHIVIST 
If there is a god, or gods, or an existence beyond this world, the Eye can't see 
it. It sees the fear of it, but… nothing of its truth. 
[Hissing static ends] 
MARTIN 
…So... is that a no?... 
ARCHIVIST 
It's an ‘I don't know,’ although… people's faith — it hasn't saved them. Not 
here. 
MARTIN 
(Quiet) True. 
ARCHIVIST 
Why do you ask? Didn't think you were at all religious. 
MARTIN 
Oh, I'm not. Mum was, but… I, I don't know. With everything going on, it, 
certainly feels less far-fetched. Besides, at this point, I'd take any help we can 
get. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 175 – Epoch 
16 
ARCHIVIST 
I don't know how kindly any god would look upon what we've done. 
(Beat) 
MARTIN 
Thanks for that. 
ARCHIVIST 
…Sorry. 
[Damp couch creak as Martin shifts] 
MARTIN 
Let's get out of here. This place is making me a bit too... existential. 
[The couch gives one last wet creak as he stands] 
ARCHIVIST 
Wait. 
[Martin stops] 
MARTIN 
What? 
ARCHIVIST 
(Sigh) Where we're going, the, uh... the next domain, I-I've been meaning to 
tell you, but it's— well. 

The Magnus Archives – MAG 175 – Epoch 
17 
MARTIN 
Spit it out, John. 
ARCHIVIST 
Basira and Daisy. We're close. 
MARTIN 
Wait, what? Wait, really?! B— th-that's brilliant; what are we waiting for; let's 
go! 
ARCHIVIST 
I-uh-yeah, i-it's, it's not, it’s not going to be easy, things aren't… Good. 
MARTIN 
(Fast, sarcastic) Oh my goodness, really? And here was me thinking the 
apocalypse was going oh, so swimmingly! 
ARCHIVIST 
Yes, alright, I just meant— 
MARTIN 
I, I know what you meant! I can still be keen to see our (slight laugh) friends! 
ARCHIVIST 
True. 
MARTIN 
Besides, we can help them now.
